title: A Fun Club Night in Glasgow with Famous DJs
summary: In Glasgow, there is a special club night called Pretty Ugly that has been running for 20 years. It was started by three friends who had no DJ experience but loved music. They play many types of songs, like pop and rock, to make people dance all night. Famous people like Kirsty Wark from TV and singers like Paolo Nutini have been DJs there. They even tried to get Nicola Sturgeon, who was Scotland's leader, but she was too busy. The club is known for being a safe and happy place where everyone can have fun together. It celebrates its anniversary with a big party at King Tut's Wah Wah Hut.
